Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999995 0.0009188891 0.0004673873
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999994 0.0010838419 0.0002534390
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999995 0.0001408026 0.0010381485
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999988 0.0010920747 0.0010540179
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999997 0.0001732988 0.0006969054
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999998 0.0006703118 0.0001796956
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999994 0.0008022186 0.0007820573
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999993 0.0008047534 0.0008373545
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999996 0.0001942678 0.0009270270
#> [10,] 1 0.9999999 0.0004439310 0.0001653802


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E         p_x        p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.89335162 -0.4432259  0.07398439
#> x 1  0.42032229  0.7129961  0.56121808
#> x 1  0.41252150 -0.8863191  0.21039142
#> x 1 -0.02626011 -0.9648759 -0.26139019
#> x 1 -0.67691082 -0.3724882 -0.63485769
#> x 1  0.84831477 -0.2316784  0.47611676
#> x 1 -0.07632373  0.7603419  0.64502313
#> x 1 -0.22083281  0.7407399 -0.63445822
#> x 1  0.60738715 -0.7767684  0.16646853
#> x 1  0.05538968 -0.5362218  0.84225780

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     4     6 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x          y           z
#> x 0.9644505  0.9289011 -0.2558966  0.04271491
#> x 0.8067741  0.6135482  0.4116485  0.32401941

#> x 0.9494383  0.8988765 -0.1337596  0.27488614
